original: bcu gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: bdag gi nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba rnams lhod par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / bdag ngan 'gro thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gi nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba rnams lhod par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / bdag ngan 'gro thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang /

original: bdag gis ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad rnam par sbyangs par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / bdag gi lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang /

translated: They strive in the perfection of discipline because they see that they will be able to make their physical, verbal, and mental actions irreproachable.

original: mkhas pa'i skye bo rnams kyis smad pa med par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / bdag bag yod pa'i chos la brten par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i skye bo rnams kyis smad pa med par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / bdag bag yod pa'i chos la brten par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang /
translated: seeing that one will not be despised by the wise, one should strive in the perfection of morality; seeing that one will be based in the Dharma of heedfulness, one should strive in the perfection of morality;

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa byin par 'gyur bar @69a *//
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa byin par 'gyur bar @69a *//

original: mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las sdom pa thob par 'gyur bar mthong bas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang /

analyzed: par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi drung du 'gro ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par bya ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang /
translated: one should undertake perseverance through the enthusiasm to go into the presence of all thus-gone ones; one should undertake perseverance through the enthusiasm to make offerings and serve all thus-gone ones; one should undertake perseverance through the enthusiasm to please all thus-gone ones;

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod pa'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi shes pa bsal ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod pa'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi shes pa bsal ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang /
translated: They should undertake perseverance through the commitment to ripen all sentient beings,🔽they should undertake perseverance through the commitment to establish all sentient beings in the qualities of the Buddha,🔽they should undertake perseverance through the commitment to dispel the ignorance of all sentient beings,🔽they should undertake perseverance through the commitment to bring the wisdom of the Buddha to all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su spyod pa'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par sems can gyi don du spyod pa spyad pas yongs su mi skyo ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su spyod pa'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par sems can gyi don du spyod pa spyad pas yongs su mi skyo ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang /
translated: they should undertake perseverance through the commitment to enjoy all buddhafields,🔽and they should undertake perseverance through the commitment to not be discouraged by engaging in conduct for the sake of sentient beings for eons that reach to the end of time.

original: skad cig gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du bla na med @71b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'gro ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du bla na med @71b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rtul bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba ste /
translated: They should undertake perseverance through the commitment to go to all world systems in an instant. They should undertake perseverance through the commitment to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and turn the wheel of the Dharma in all buddhafields.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: rtul ba bcu gnyis po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ste /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //

analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya phyir brtson 'grus can //

analyzed: le lo med pa de dag brtson 'grus mi nyams 'dod //

analyzed: zhing kun rnam par sbyong bar bdag ni smon lam 'debs //

analyzed: chos rnams 'di dag thams cad rnam pa kun rtogs bya //
translated: I want to understand all these dharmas.🔽I want to turn the wheel of the Dharma in all the hundred buddhafields.

analyzed: zhing brgya kun tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya; ;theg pa mchog la bdag gis sems can bye ba gdul //
translated: I want to train billions of sentient beings in the supreme vehicle.

analyzed: shin tu rgya chen zhing rnams sprul pa byas nas su //
translated: Having emanated buddhafields that are vast,

analyzed: sems kyi skad cig gcig la byang chub mchog 'tshang @72a *//
translated: in a single instant of mind I will attain supreme awakening.

analyzed: rgya; ;rgyal ba'i sras po brtson 'grus pha rol dong pa dag /
translated: “The bodhisattvas, the Victor’s sons, who have reached the perfection of effort,

analyzed: sems can don du rnam par 'phrul pa 'di na ston //
translated: display these manifestations here for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis bsam gtan rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas should cultivate the meditative concentrations with twelve aspects.

original: bcu gnyis po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis po de dag gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: shin tu mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i rnam pa dang / yul rnams la mi rgyug pa'i phyir sems gnas pa'i rnam pa dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir mi ngas pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i rnam pa dang / yul rnams la mi rgyug pa'i phyir sems gnas pa'i rnam pa dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir mi ngas pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: The aspect of pacifying the afflictions because of being utterly unperturbed; the aspect of the mind abiding because of not running after objects; the aspect of non-violence because of transcending the realms of desire, form, and formlessness;

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa dang / de la ma chags pa'i phyir khyad par gyi rnam pa dang / bsam gtan zlog pa'i phyir 'dod rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / dngos po'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa dang / de la ma chags pa'i phyir khyad par gyi rnam pa dang / bsam gtan zlog pa'i phyir 'dod rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / dngos po'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa dang /
translated: It is the aspect of transcending the world because it surpasses mundane meditative attainment, the aspect of distinction because it is not attached to that, the aspect of spontaneity because it turns away from the absorptions, the aspect of nature because it is free of the perception of entities,

original: tshad yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la smod pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i rnam pa dang / shin tu zhi ba'i phyir zhi gnas kyi rnam pa dang / cang shes pa'i phyir sems dul ba'i rnam pa dang / dbang po nges par bsdams pa'i phyir nges par sems pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: tshad yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la smod pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i rnam pa dang / shin tu zhi ba'i phyir zhi gnas kyi rnam pa dang / cang shes pa'i phyir sems dul ba'i rnam pa dang / dbang po nges par bsdams pa'i phyir nges par sems pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: the aspect of immeasurability because it criticizes limited concentration, the aspect of sustained calm because it is utterly peaceful, the aspect of a trained mind because it is fully cognizant, the aspect of certainty because it restrains the sense faculties,🔽the aspect of skill in means because it does not abandon the intention to attain enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi bsam pa ma bor ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pa'i rnam pas @72b byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan sgom gyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi bsam pa ma bor ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pa'i rnam pas @72b byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan sgom gyi /

analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / sred pa shes che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni /

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad zil gyis gnon to //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan rnams bsgom par bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas should cultivate meditative concentration through these twelve aspects.

original: bsam gtan de'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan de'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: And they should dedicate that meditative concentration to omniscience.🔽Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to; ;byang chub sems dpa' gzi ldan pa //

analyzed: de nyid de dag bsam gtan ni //

analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad zhi phyir dang / shin tu 'khrug med don phyir yin //
translated: is for the sake of pacifying all afflictions and for the sake of complete imperturbability.

analyzed: sems 'khrul gyur pa gnas rnams su //

analyzed: rtag par yang dag rab tu sbyor //

analyzed: mi gnas de dag bsam gtan byed // 'dod dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa //
translated: They practice concentration without abiding.🔽They do not abide in the desire realm,

original: gang la'ang de dag mi gnas te //

original: de dag mi gnas bsam gtan byed //
analyzed: de dag mi gnas bsam gtan byed //

original: byang chub sems dpa' ye shes can //

analyzed: de dag bsam gtan las su rung //

analyzed: ji ltar @73a *//

analyzed: 'dod bzhin dbang yang 'gyur //

analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pas 'phags //

analyzed: sems can med chos dri med de //

analyzed: de dag bsam gtan tshad med do //

analyzed: phyogs gcig bsam gtan byed pa dag /

original: shes rab thabs dang ldan pa po //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang ldan pa po //

analyzed: dngos la mi gnas shes rab ldan //
translated: They are endowed with wisdom that does not dwell on entities,

analyzed: dngos po med la'ang mi gnas te //
translated: And do not dwell on non-entities.

original: dngos dang dngos med 'du shes spangs //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med 'du shes spangs //
translated: They have abandoned the concepts of entities and non-entities,

original: de dag bsam gtan bsam gtan byed //
analyzed: de dag bsam gtan bsam gtan byed //
translated: And they are the ones who practice meditation.

original: gzi ldan de dag 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: gzi ldan de dag 'dra ba yi //

original: rnam pas mnyam med bsam gtan byed //
analyzed: rnam pas mnyam med bsam gtan byed //

analyzed: de la dgra bcom rang sangs rgyas //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya'o; ;bcu gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
translated: The bodhisattvas should realize the perfection of wisdom through twelve aspects. What are the twelve?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gti mug gi mun pa mun nag med pa'i phyir snang ba'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i thibs po snang bar byed pa'i phyir @73b sgron ma'i rnam pa dang / mi shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ye shes kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa mun nag med pa'i phyir snang ba'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i thibs po snang bar byed pa'i phyir @73b sgron ma'i rnam pa dang / mi shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ye shes kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: It is the aspect of light because the darkness of ignorance is absent. It is the aspect of a lamp because it illuminates the thickets of afflictions. It is the aspect of the light rays of wisdom because it is free from ignorance.

original: ma rig pa drungs nas 'byin pa'i phyir thong gshol gyi rnam pa dang / sred pa'i rgya mo rnam par 'jig par byed pa'i phyir lcags kyu'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa rdul du rlog pa'i phyir rdo rje'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dam rdzab skem pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa drungs nas 'byin pa'i phyir thong gshol gyi rnam pa dang / sred pa'i rgya mo rnam par 'jig par byed pa'i phyir lcags kyu'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa rdul du rlog pa'i phyir rdo rje'i rnam pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dam rdzab skem pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa dang /
translated: It is the aspect of a plow because it uproots ignorance. It is the aspect of a hook because it destroys the net of craving. It is the aspect of a vajra because it pulverizes the afflictions. It is the aspect of the orb of the sun because it dries up the swamp of afflictions.

original: skye ba'i shing sreg pa'i phyir me'i rnam pa dang / rmongs pa med par byed pa'i phyir nor bu lta bu'i rnam pa dang / rdzas med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba'i shing sreg pa'i phyir me'i rnam pa dang / rmongs pa med par byed pa'i phyir nor bu lta bu'i rnam pa dang / rdzas med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: The aspect of fire is for the sake of burning the wood of birth. The aspect of the jewel is for the sake of dispelling delusion. The aspect of emptiness is for the sake of the absence of substance. The aspect of signlessness is for the sake of the absence of characteristics.

original: khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir smon pa med pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir smon pa med pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of wishlessness is for the sake of transcending the three realms.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas should realize the perfection of wisdom through these twelve aspects.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: shes rab 'phags pa 'di ni snang lta bur //
analyzed: shes rab 'phags pa 'di ni snang lta bur //
translated: This noble wisdom is like a light,

original: rtag tu skye rgu rnams kyi mun pa sel //
analyzed: rtag tu skye rgu rnams kyi mun pa sel //
translated: Always dispelling the darkness for beings.

original: de ni sgron ma lta bur snang phyir byung //
analyzed: de ni sgron ma lta bur snang phyir byung //

original: nyon mongs tshogs la 'di ni snang bar byed //
analyzed: nyon mongs tshogs la 'di ni snang bar byed //

original: sred dang rmongs pa'i rtsa rnams bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sred dang rmongs pa'i rtsa rnams bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to remove the roots of craving and delusion,

translated: The Tathāgata has taught it as a way of engaging.

original: de ni / de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa /
analyzed: de ni / de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa /
translated: The Tathāgata has presented the Dharma.

original: de ni / de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa la rim gyis 'jug par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni / de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa la rim gyis 'jug par bstan pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata has taught the gradual engagement.

original: tshogs chung ngu dang / tshogs chen po'i gang zag rnams rnam par dgod pa thabs mkhas pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs chung ngu dang / tshogs chen po'i gang zag rnams rnam par dgod pa thabs mkhas pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ste /
translated: The presentation of individuals with small and great accumulations is a skillful magical display.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa sna tshogs dang / kun rdzob la 'jug pa bstan pa yin par de ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa sna tshogs dang / kun rdzob la 'jug pa bstan pa yin par de ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s various correct knowledges and teachings on engaging the conventional should be understood in that way.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: In the ultimate,

original: theg pa gcig ste /
analyzed: theg pa gcig ste /
translated: There is only one vehicle,

original: gnyis su med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med do //
translated: not two.

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang kun tu rgyu dag snang ba 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang kun tu rgyu dag snang ba 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the appearance in this buddha field of non-Buddhists, such as the carakas and parivrājakas, should be regarded as a skillful means of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mnga' dbang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mnga' dbang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the power of the Tathāgata’s blessing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas ni; gnyen po thams cad shin tu bsal ba'i phyir phyir rgol ba thams cad kyi thams cad med de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas ni; gnyen po thams cad shin tu bsal ba'i phyir phyir rgol ba thams cad kyi thams cad med de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata has no opponents at all, because he has completely eliminated all counteragents.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig pa'i tshul can dang ldan pa /🔽'dod chags dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig pa'i tshul can dang ldan pa / 'dod chags dang bcas pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a universal monarch who possesses the means to destroy the roots of virtue,🔽who is endowed with desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa /
translated: hatred,

original: gti mug dang bcas pa /🔽nye bar len pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa /
translated: ignorance,🔽appropriation,

original: bag la nyal dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bag la nyal dang bcas pa /
translated: and latent tendencies,

original: @80a *// nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa la'ang phyir rgol pa thams cad kyi thams cad med cing bsdo ba'i dmag tshogs med do //
analyzed: @80a *// nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa la'ang phyir rgol pa thams cad kyi thams cad med cing bsdo ba'i dmag tshogs med do //
translated: He has no army to muster.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is because the universal monarch is not harmed.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'ang de lta na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'ang de lta na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if the universal monarch is like this,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pa /
translated: then what need is there to speak of the Thus-Gone One, the great universal monarch of the Dharma, who has accumulated immeasurable collections of merit and wisdom,

original: snying rje chen po rgyun mi chad pa brnyes pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po rgyun mi chad pa brnyes pa /
translated: who has attained uninterrupted great compassion,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi nam mkha' la rgyu ba /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi nam mkha' la rgyu ba /
translated: who moves through the sky of the uncontaminated Dharma,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi rin po che dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi rin po che dang ldan pa /
translated: who possesses the seven jewels of the branches of awakening,

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can /
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos can /
translated: who is not subject to forgetfulness,

original: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i chos kyi rgyal srid la 'tshe ba yod pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i chos kyi rgyal srid la 'tshe ba yod pa'am /
translated: and who is the Dharma king who turns the wheel of the Dharma?

original: bsngo ba'i dmag tshogs kyi 'jigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: bsngo ba'i dmag tshogs kyi 'jigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: How could there be any fear of the army of the dedication?

original: de ni / gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med do //
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: 'jam dpal / yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu gang dag snang ba 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu gang dag snang ba 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, those non-Buddhists, the carakas, the parivrājakas, who appear in this buddha-field, should be regarded as the magical emanations of the Tathāgata.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de dag kun kyang mu stegs can gcig la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kun kyang mu stegs can gcig la gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that they all abide in a single non-Buddhist school.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / ri dvags kyi rgyal po sengge'i mdun du ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste / dper na / ri dvags kyi rgyal po sengge'i mdun du ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: ri dvags phra @80b mo thams cad gnas par mi nus so //
analyzed: ri dvags phra @80b mo thams cad gnas par mi nus so //
translated: all small animals are unable to stand before the lion, the king of beasts.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul mnan par bya ba'am; de bzhin gshegs pa skyes bu sengge chen po stobs bcu mnga' ba mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa'i mdun du gnas par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul mnan par bya ba'am; de bzhin gshegs pa skyes bu sengge chen po stobs bcu mnga' ba mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa'i mdun du gnas par bya ba'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, no non-Buddhist, no Caraka, no Parivrājaka can stand in the presence of the Tathāgata, the great lion of men, the one who possesses the ten powers and has attained the four forms of fearlessness, in order to debate with him,

original: brtsad par bya bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: brtsad par bya bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par mi nus te /
translated: except through the blessing of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni / gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med do //
translated: This is impossible.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar zhing 'od zer mang po bkye ba'i tshe srin bu me khyer thams cad kyang 'od med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar zhing 'od zer mang po bkye ba'i tshe srin bu me khyer thams cad kyang 'od med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: when the orb of the sun rises and emits many light rays, all fireflies lose their light,

original: me dang / nor bu dang / skar ma thams cad kyi 'od zer rnams kyang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: me dang / nor bu dang / skar ma thams cad kyi 'od zer rnams kyang mi snang ngo //
translated: and the light rays of all fires, jewels, and stars do not shine.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po shar zhing ye shes kyi 'od zer mang po bkye ba'i tshe gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad zil gyis non cing mi snang po //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po shar zhing ye shes kyi 'od zer mang po bkye ba'i tshe gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad zil gyis non cing mi snang po //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, when the great sun-like disk of the Tathāgata rises and emits many light rays of wisdom, all the non-Buddhist practitioners and wandering mendicants are outshone and do not appear.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / lcags kyi rgyal po khab long sa'i phyogs gang du byung ba der khab long mi 'dre ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir lcags thams cad mi gnas so; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: dper na / lcags kyi rgyal po khab long sa'i phyogs gang du byung ba der khab long mi 'dre ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir lcags thams cad mi gnas so; ;'jam dpal /
translated: for example, wherever the king of metals, the magnet, is found, all other metals do not remain there because of the characteristic of being repelled by the magnet.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang du sangs rgyas byung bar gyur pa der ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang du sangs rgyas byung bar gyur pa der ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, in whatever buddha-field the Buddha appears,

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad rgyu ba med par rig par @81a *//
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad rgyu ba med par rig par @81a *//
translated: it should be known that all the non-Buddhist practitioners and wandering mendicants do not wander there.

original: bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / sangs rgyas byung ba'i mi 'dre ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni / sangs rgyas byung ba'i mi 'dre ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the characteristic of the uniqueness of the appearance of the Buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / rin po che'i rgyal po yid bzhin gyi nor bu gang du byung ba der ni /
analyzed: dper na / rin po che'i rgyal po yid bzhin gyi nor bu gang du byung ba der ni /
translated: Wherever a precious king of wish-fulfilling gems appears,

original: mching bu rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mching bu rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: there will be no occurrence of glass.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che chen po gang du byung ba der ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che chen po gang du byung ba der ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, likewise, wherever a tathāgata, a great precious gem of wisdom, appears,

original: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: there will be no occurrence of any non-Buddhists, such as carakas, parivrājakas, or parivrāji.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / rin po che'i 'byung khungs gang nas dzambu'i chu bo'i gser byung ba de nas lcags 'gyes kyi phung po mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na / rin po che'i 'byung khungs gang nas dzambu'i chu bo'i gser byung ba de nas lcags 'gyes kyi phung po mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Wherever a source of precious gems appears, there will be no occurrence of heaps of iron ore.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gang du de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gang du de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, likewise, wherever a tathāgata appears in a world system, there will be no occurrence of any non-Buddhists, such as carakas, parivrājakas, or parivrāji.

original: 'jam dpal / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gang du byung ba der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad mi 'byung par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gang du byung ba der gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu thams cad mi 'byung par rig par bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, by this approach you should understand that wherever the Tathāgata appears, there no other tīrthikas, no wandering mendicants, will appear.

original: 'jam dpal / yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu gang dag snang ba 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par @81b rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na gzhan mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu gang dag snang ba 'di'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par @81b rig par bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, you should understand that the appearance of other tīrthikas, wandering mendicants, and brahmins in this buddha field is also the inconceivable domain of the tathāgatas’ blessings and skillful means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mu stegs can gzhan gyi sgo 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar mu stegs can gzhan gyi sgo 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: Because all these other tīrthikas

original: rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgo la gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgo la gnas pa dag ste /
translated: are established in the gateway to the inconceivable liberation

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par byung ba dag go /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par byung ba dag go /
translated: and have emerged from the perfection of wisdom.

original: thabs la mkhas pas rnam par rtse ba dag go /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas rnam par rtse ba dag go /
translated: They are playing with skillful means.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba ma btang ba dag go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba ma btang ba dag go /
translated: They never gave up bringing to mind the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnams la dam pa'i pha rol tu song pa dag go /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnams la dam pa'i pha rol tu song pa dag go /
translated: They had perfected the highest virtue in bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag go /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag go /
translated: They had been blessed by the Thus-Gone One’s blessing in order to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: bstan pa 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas pa brgyad stong gis theg pa gcig ces thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas pa brgyad stong gis theg pa gcig ces thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: When this teaching was given, eight thousand gods who were following the vehicle of the hearers heard the word “one vehicle” and gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: dge slong lnga brgyas theg pa gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba'i sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgyas theg pa gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba'i sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur to //
translated: Five hundred monks attained the absorption of the lamp that gathers into one vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong nyis brgyas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong nyis brgyas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Twelve hundred bodhisattvas attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena do not arise.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'ang rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'ang rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: This trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: steng gi bar snang las kyang lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po'i char mngon par pang bo //🔽lha'i tshandan gyi phye ma'i char dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du @82a *//
analyzed: steng gi bar snang las kyang lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po'i char mngon par pang bo // lha'i tshandan gyi phye ma'i char dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du @82a *//
translated: From the sky above, a rain of divine flowers fell, including utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka flowers.

original: bab par gyur to //
analyzed: bab par gyur to //
translated: A rain of divine sandalwood fell upon the feet of the Thus-Gone One.

original: lha'i bu 'bum dag kyang steng gi bar snang la 'dug nas ca co dang / ga zha'i sgra brgya stong du ma byung bar gyur te lha'i gos dag kyang g-yab mo thabs su g-yob bo //
analyzed: lha'i bu 'bum dag kyang steng gi bar snang la 'dug nas ca co dang / ga zha'i sgra brgya stong du ma byung bar gyur te lha'i gos dag kyang g-yab mo thabs su g-yob bo //
translated: Hundreds of thousands of gods in the sky above cried out in hundreds of thousands of voices, waved their divine garments,

original: lha'i rnga dag kyang brdungs par gyur to //
analyzed: lha'i rnga dag kyang brdungs par gyur to //
translated: and beat their divine drums.

original: ched du brjod pa 'di skad kyang ched du brjod de /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa 'di skad kyang ched du brjod de /
translated: They exclaimed:

original: kye ma sngon ma thos pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: kye ma sngon ma thos pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: “Ah! A Dharma discourse never heard before has appeared in the world!

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yun ring por dzambu'i gling na gnas par gyur cig /🔽ces pa rjod do //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yun ring por dzambu'i gling na gnas par gyur cig / ces pa rjod do //
translated: May this Dharma discourse remain for a long time in Jambudvīpa.🔽🔽

original: dge slong ma brgyad brgyas kyang rang rang gi bla gos de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la gsol par gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong ma brgyad brgyas kyang rang rang gi bla gos de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la gsol par gyur to //
translated: Eight hundred nuns also offered their upper robes to the Tathāgata.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then, in order to explain this meaning extensively, the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: nga yi thabs yul bsam gyis mi khyab 'di //
analyzed: nga yi thabs yul bsam gyis mi khyab 'di //
translated: “This inconceivable field of activity of my skillful means

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis de ltar shes par gyis //
translated: you should understand in this way, Mañjuśrī.

original: bcud kyi dus la byang chub sangs rgyas kyang //
analyzed: bcud kyi dus la byang chub sangs rgyas kyang //
translated: Even though I attained enlightenment in the past,

original: 'di 'dra'i dus ni nga ni ston pa mdzad //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i dus ni nga ni ston pa mdzad //
translated: at this time I act as a teacher.

original: nga la dus kyi nyes pa mi mnga' ste //
analyzed: nga la dus kyi nyes pa mi mnga' ste //
translated: I am not subject to the faults of time,

original: chos kyi dus ni rtag tu nye bar gnas //
analyzed: chos kyi dus ni rtag tu nye bar gnas //
translated: and the time for the Dharma always remains.

original: nga las sems can chos thos 'jug par byed //

translated: I will gather together the learned brahmins who are skilled in the meaning of the Dharma and have them debate.🔽Having debated in this way, I will support the side of whoever speaks correctly and will expel

analyzed: rgyal po de nyid kyis so //

translated: Because they do not share with those who are worthy of a share of the things that should be given to those beings who are to be benefited. Because they are alone in their practice, it is a great wrong livelihood.”

original: smras pa / bram ze /
analyzed: smras pa / bram ze /
translated: He replied, “Brahmin,

analyzed: chos nyid dang 'gal ba'i kha zas stob pa'am / dbyug pa'am @99a *//

analyzed: lag pas brdeg pa'am /

analyzed: mtshon gyis brdeg pa de dag mi srun pa'i phyogs gang gi nang du bgrang bar bya /

original: smras pa / rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyal po chen po /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: log par zhugs pa chen po lags pa'i slad du ste /

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /

original: log par zhugs ba de lta bus ni /
analyzed: log par zhugs ba de lta bus ni /
translated: because of such going astray,

original: gnod pa can /

analyzed: nad 'go ba can du 'gyur zhing tshe'ang yongs su 'bri /

analyzed: longs spyod kyang yongs su 'bri /

original: nad med pa'ang yongs su 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad med pa'ang yongs su 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and their health will deteriorate.🔽”

original: smras pa; bram ze /
analyzed: smras pa; bram ze /
translated: “Brahmin,
